fragment.headline: DJ CHINA PRESS: Netcom Wants IPO Shr Price Set Around Jan 15
fragment.text:
BEIJING (Dow Jones)--China Netcom Group has asked advisers to decide on the price of its initial public offering shares during the week of Jan. 15, with a final decision expected by Jan. 22, the Beijing Morning Post reports.

The country's second largest fixed-line operator is likely to list no later than the summer of 2004, based on the group's current restructuring schedule, industry sources said without elaborating, according to the paper.

Earlier reports have said Netcom intends to list shares in Hong Kong and New York.

It is the only entity among China's four large state-run telecom companies that remains unlisted. Dominant fixed-line operator China Telecom Group lists part of its assets as China Telecom Corp. (CHA), while mobile phone network duopoly China Mobile Communications Corp. and China United Telecommunications Corp. list a portion of their assets as China Mobile Ltd. (CHL) and China Unicom Ltd. (CHU), respectively.

Newspaper Web site: http://www.morningpost.com.cn

-By China Bureau, Dow Jones Newswires; 8610 6588-5848; djnews.beijing@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires
